intro: Pedicularis spicata var. sesinowii, commonly known as the Himalayan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. This variety is characterized by its erect stem and clusters of small, reddish-pink to purple flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged opposite along the stem. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cold, nutrient-poor soils.
